channel.title: hl2 citadel sound in god of war 3
channel.description:
hey guys, you might remember the thread about the hl2 citadel sounds,the screams... i was watching [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EplIIXbLGqU&feature=channel_video_title']this god of war 3 walkthrough[/url] and noticed the sounds at 11 minutes and 39 seconds, right before kratos opens the red chest and a few ties later in that video... did valve make the sounds? i think so, but is sharing sounds between developers that common? well i knew about several usages of hl2 fast zombie screams (even though valve just modified it for their purpose) in different movies or games, but the citadel sounds ? i just thought his was a notable thing and wanted to share it
-Warning: link has spoilers about god of war 3 in it

im not talking about sirens -.-
dont you know the citadel screams ?!
…
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qt9VT2wfN_E
the first part
listen carefully and dont deny the truth. you didnt know about that sound.
however, it doesnt matter since the second aprt of your post is true.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cdbYsoEasio
everybody has heard this wilhelm scream somewhere
btw the wilhelm scream is also in gow3

kinda stupid, this copy paste shit. i mean, it cant be that hard to record a scream and modify it so u can use it properly …

item.source: hl2 citadel sound in god of war 3

item.title: hl2 citadel sound in god of war 3
item.dc:creator: Vibez
item.description:
It’s not the same sound. It’s hardly even similar.

Here’s actual citadel alert: https://cl.ly/3x322D25260O1u220B3Z.

Maybe you thought of city siren sound? -> https://cl.ly/2B1h3l2D3t0b021f2R3i

And by the way, get used to this. Even the biggest game companies and film studios use commonly known and ‘worn out’ samples. It’s kinda sad, taking into account the fact that sound designers and producers don’t cost much. I guess only the best directors and crews don’t let that happen, creating their own each time.

Oh, and if you recall, one of the most popular sample that is being used everywhere since a couple of years was also used by Valve in Counter Strike Source, when you hit any car model with a grenade. I can’t find it on web but if you played CSS you know what I mean.

Read full topic
